a.g: We have certainly seen the turning of your face, [O Muhammad], toward the heaven, and We will surely turn you to a qiblah with which you will be pleased. So turn your face toward al-Masjid al-Haram. And wherever you [believers] are, turn your faces toward it [in prayer]. Indeed, those who have been given the Scripture well know that it is the truth from their Lord. And Allah is not unaware of what they do.
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
أما الكتاب فقوله تعالى وحيثما كنتم فولوا وجوهكم شطره أي نحوه ومن قابل جهة الكعبة يقال قد ولى وجهه شطرها
Indeed, as for the Book [al-Kitab], it is His saying, the Most High: "And wherever you are, turn your faces [wujuhakum] towards its direction [shatrah]." That is, towards it. And whoever faces the direction of the Ka'bah, it is said: "He has turned his face [wajhahu] towards its direction [shatraha]."

a.g: And if you brought to those who were given the Scripture every sign, they would not follow your qiblah. Nor will you be a follower of their qiblah. Nor would they be followers of one another's qiblah. So if you were to follow their desires after what has come to you of knowledge, indeed, you would then be among the wrongdoers.
Those to whom We gave the Scripture know him as they know their own sons. But indeed, a party of them conceal the truth while they know [it].
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
وقال تعالى: ﴿وإن فريقا منهم ليكتمون الحق وهم يعلمون﴾ ( سورة البقرة: الآية 146) وهو تحريم للكتمان كما قال تعالى في الشهادة: ﴿ومن يكتمها فإنه آثم قلبه﴾ ( سورة البقرة: الآية 283) وقال صلى الله عليه وسلم: (ما آتى الله عالما علما إلا وأخذ عليه من الميثاق ما أخذ على النبيين أن يبينوه للناس ولا يكتموه).
Indeed, the Most High has said: "And indeed, a party among them conceal the truth [al-haqq] while they know [it]." (Surah Al-Baqarah: 146) And this is a prohibition of concealment [al-kitman], just as the Most High said concerning testimony: "And whoever conceals it, then indeed, he is sinful in heart [qalb]." (Surah Al-Baqarah: 283) And the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Allah does not grant a scholar [alim] knowledge [ilm] except that He takes from him a covenant [al-mithaq] like the covenant He took from the Prophets: that he make it clear to the people and not conceal it."

a.g: The truth is from your Lord, so never be among the doubters.

For each [religious following] is a direction toward which it faces. So race to [all that is] good. Wherever you may be, Allah will bring you forth [for judgement] all together. Indeed, Allah is over all things competent.
So from wherever you go out [for prayer, O Muhammad] turn your face toward al- Masjid al-Haram, and indeed, it is the truth from your Lord. And Allah is not unaware of what you do.

And from wherever you go out [for prayer], turn your face toward al-Masjid al-Haram. And wherever you [believers] may be, turn your faces toward it in order that the people will not have any argument against you, except for those of them who commit wrong; so fear them not but fear Me. And [it is] so I may complete My favor upon you and that you may be guided.
Just as We have sent among you a messenger from yourselves reciting to you Our verses and purifying you and teaching you the Book and wisdom and teaching you that which you did not know.
So remember Me; I will remember you. And be grateful to Me and do not deny Me.
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
و يدل على فضيلة الذكر على الجملة من الآيات قوله سبحانه وتعالى: ﴿ فاذكروني أذكركم ﴾ {} قال ثابت البناني رحمه الله: إني أعلم متى يذكرني ربي عز وجل ففزعوا منه وقالوا كيف تعلم ذلك فقال إذا ذكرته ذكرني
Know that God the Exalted has coupled gratitude [shukr] with remembrance [dhikr] in His Book, even though He said: "And the remembrance of God is greater." Indeed, He the Exalted said: "So remember Me; I will remember you. And be grateful to Me and do not deny Me." And He the Exalted said: "What would God do with your punishment if you are grateful and believe?" And He the Exalted said: "And We will reward the grateful." And He, Mighty and Majestic, said, informing about the accursed Iblis: "I will surely sit in wait for them on Your straight path." It is said it is the path of gratitude [shukr], and due to the loftiness of the rank of gratitude [shukr], the accursed one cast aspersions on creation, saying: "And you will not find most of them grateful [shakirin]." And He the Exalted said: "And few of My servants are grateful [shakur]." And God the Exalted has decreed increase with gratitude [shukr] without exception, for He the Exalted said: "If you are grateful, I will surely increase you." And He made exceptions in five things: in granting sufficiency, in answering, in provision, in forgiveness, and in repentance. For He the Exalted said: "Then God will grant you sufficiency from His bounty, if He wills." And He said: "He removes that for which you supplicate Him, if He wills." And He said: "He provides for whom He wills without account." And He said: "And He forgives what is less than that for whom He wills." And He said: "And God turns in forgiveness to whom He wills." And it is a creation from the attributes of Lordship, for He the Exalted said: "And God is Appreciative [shakur] and Forbearing." And God has made gratitude [shukr] the key speech of the people of Paradise, for He the Exalted said: "And they will say, 'Praise to God, who has fulfilled for us His promise.'" And He said: "And their final call will be, 'Praise to God, Lord of the worlds.'" As for the narrations, the Messenger of God, peace be upon him, said: "The grateful eater is of the same rank as the patient faster." And it is narrated from 'Ata that he said: "I entered upon 'A'ishah, may God be pleased with her, and said, 'Inform us of the most amazing thing you saw from the Messenger of God, peace be upon him.' She wept and said, 'And which of his affairs was not amazing? He came to me one night and entered the bed with me'—or she said, 'my blanket'—'until his skin touched my skin. Then he said, "O daughter of Abu Bakr, allow me to worship my Lord." I said, "I love your closeness, but I prefer your desire." So I gave him permission. He stood up to a water-skin, performed ablution without using much water, then stood to pray. He wept until his tears flowed onto his chest. Then he bowed and wept. Then he prostrated and wept. Then he raised his head and wept. He continued like that, weeping, until Bilal came to give the call to prayer. I said, 'O Messenger of God, what makes you weep when God has forgiven your past and future sins?' He said, 'Should I not be a grateful servant [abdan shakura]?'"

a.g: O you who have believed, seek help through patience and prayer. Indeed, Allah is with the patient.
And do not say about those who are killed in the way of Allah, "They are dead." Rather, they are alive, but you perceive [it] not.
And We will surely test you with something of fear and hunger and a loss of wealth and lives and fruits, but give good tidings to the patient,
Who, when disaster strikes them, say, "Indeed we belong to Allah, and indeed to Him we will return."
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
القسم الثالث: ما لا يدخل تحت حصر الاختيار اوله وآخره كالمصائب مثل موت الاعزة وهلاك الاموال وزوال الصحة بالمرض وعمى العين وفساد الاعضاء وبالجملة سائر انواع البلاء فالصبر على ذلك من أعلى مقامات الصبر. قال ابن عباس رضي الله عنهما: الصبر في القران على ثلاثة أوجه: صبر على أداء فرائض الله تعالى فله ثلثمائة درجة وصبر عن محارم الله تعالى فله ستمائة درجة وصبر على المصيبة عند الصدمة الاولى فله تسعمائة درجة وإنما فضلت هذه الرتبة مع انها من الفضائل على ما قبلها وهي من الفرائض لأن كل مؤمن يقدر على الصبر عن المحارم. فأما الصبر على بلاء الله تعالى فلا يقدر عليه الا الأنبياء لأنه بضاعة الصديقين فان ذلك شديد على النفس ولذلك قال ﭬ: (أسألك من اليقين ما تهون على به مصائب الدنيا[26]) فهذا صبر مستنده حسن اليقين. وقال النبي ﭬ: (قال الله عز وجل اذا وجهت الى عبد من عبيدي مصيبة في بدنه او ماله وولده ثم استقبل ذلك بصبر جميل استحييت منه يوم القيامة ان انصب له ميزانا او أنشر له ديوانا[27]). وقال ﭬ: (ما من عبد مؤمن اصيب بمصيبة فقال كما امر الله تعالى: ﴿ انا لله وانا اليه راجعون ﴾ {} اللهم اؤجرني بمصيبتي واعقبني خيرا منها إلا فعل الله به ذلك[29]).
Indeed, the third category: that which does not fall under the scope of choice, neither its beginning nor its end, such as calamities [masha'ib]—like the death of loved ones, the loss of wealth, the removal of health through illness, the blindness of the eye, the corruption of limbs, and in sum, all other types of affliction [bala']. So patience [sabr] upon that is from the highest stations of patience. Ibn Abbas, may God be pleased with them both, said: "Patience in the Quran is upon three aspects: patience upon performing the obligations [fara'id] of God, the Exalted, for it are three hundred degrees; and patience in abstaining from the prohibitions [maharim] of God, the Exalted, for it are six hundred degrees; and patience upon the calamity [musiba] at the first shock, for it are nine hundred degrees." And this rank is favored, even though it is from the virtues [fada'il] over what preceded it—and they are from the obligations—because every believer is capable of patience in abstaining from the prohibitions. As for patience upon the affliction [bala'] of God, the Exalted, none can bear it except the Prophets, for it is the merchandise of the truthful [siddiqin]; indeed, that is severe upon the soul [nafs], and for that reason He, peace be upon him, said: "I ask You for such certainty [yaqin] that by it the calamities of the world [dunya] are made light for me." So this is a patience whose foundation is sound certainty [yaqin]. And the Prophet, peace be upon him, said: "God, Mighty and Majestic, said: 'When I direct a calamity [musiba] to a servant from My servants in his body, or his wealth, or his child, then he meets that with beautiful patience [sabr jamil], I am ashamed before him on the Day of Resurrection to set up a scale for him or to unfurl a record for him.'" And He, peace be upon him, said: "There is no believing servant afflicted by a calamity [musiba] who says as God, the Exalted, has commanded: 'Indeed we belong to God, and indeed to Him we return,' and 'O God, reward me for my calamity and grant me better than it,' except that God will do that for him."

a.g: Those are the ones upon whom are blessings from their Lord and mercy. And it is those who are the [rightly] guided.
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
وعلق النصرة على الصبر فقال تعالى: ﴿ بلى إن تصبروا وتتقوا ويأتوكم من فورهم هذا يمددكم ربكم بخمسة آلاف من الملائكة مسومين ﴾ {} وجمع للصابرين بين أمور لم يجمعها لغيرهم فقال تعالى: ﴿ أولئك عليهم صلوات من ربهم ورحمة وأولئك هم المهتدون ﴾ {} فالهدى والرحمة والصلوات مجموعة للصابرين واستقصاء جميع الآيات في مقام الصبر يطول.
Indeed, He has made victory contingent upon patience [sabr], so the Most High has said: "Yes, if you are patient [tasbiru] and are mindful of God [tattaqū] and they come upon you swiftly, your Lord will reinforce you with five thousand angels, marked." And He has gathered for the patient [ṣābirīn] matters which He has not gathered for others, so the Most High has said: "Those—upon them are prayers [ṣalawāt] from their Lord and mercy [raḥma], and those are the guided [al-muhtadūn]." Thus, guidance [al-hudā] and mercy [raḥma] and prayers [ṣalawāt] are gathered for the patient [ṣābirīn]. To exhaust all the verses concerning the station of patience [ṣabr] would be lengthy.

a.g: Indeed, as-Safa and al-Marwah are among the symbols of Allah. So whoever makes Hajj to the House or performs 'umrah - there is no blame upon him for walking between them. And whoever volunteers good - then indeed, Allah is appreciative and Knowing.
Indeed, those who conceal what We sent down of clear proofs and guidance after We made it clear for the people in the Scripture - those are cursed by Allah and cursed by those who curse,
Except for those who repent and correct themselves and make evident [what they concealed]. Those - I will accept their repentance, and I am the Accepting of repentance, the Merciful.
Indeed, those who disbelieve and die while they are disbelievers - upon them will be the curse of Allah and of the angels and the people, all together,
Abiding eternally therein. The punishment will not be lightened for them, nor will they be reprieved.
And your god is one God. There is no deity [worthy of worship] except Him, the Entirely Merciful, the Especially Merciful.
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
إن القلب إذا استعد لذكر الله تعالى وتجرد عن علائق الدنيا، انكشف له سر التوحيد، فإذا قرأ العبد عند نومه قوله تعالى: ﴿ وإلهكم إله واحد لا إله إلا هو ﴾ إلى قوله: ﴿ لقوم يعقلون ﴾، تذكّر أن الإله الواحد هو المستحق للعبادة دون سواه، فيستدل من ذلك أن حفظ القرآن وعدم نسيانه إنما هو بركة من بركات هذا التوحيد، لأن من أخلص لله في ذكره حفظه الله في يقظته ومنامه، فالتوحيد يوجب للعبد الأمن والطمأنينة، ويقي قلبه من الشواغل التي تنسيه كتاب ربه.
Indeed, when the heart [qalb] is prepared for the remembrance of God [dhikr Allah] and is stripped of the attachments of the world [dunya], the secret of divine oneness [sirr al-tawhid] is unveiled to it. So when the servant recites at the time of his sleep the saying of God, the Exalted: "And your god is one God. There is no deity except Him..." to His saying: "...for a people who use reason," he remembers that the One God [al-Ilah al-Wahid] is the One deserving of worship to the exclusion of all others. He then deduces from this that the preservation of the Qur'an and the absence of forgetting it are but a blessing from the blessings of this divine oneness [tawhid], for whoever is sincere [akhlasa] to God in his remembrance, God preserves him in his wakefulness and his sleep. Thus, divine oneness [tawhid] necessitates for the servant security [al-amn] and tranquility [al-tuma'ninah], and it protects his heart [qalb] from the distractions [shawaghil] that would make him forget the Book of his Lord.

a.g: Indeed, in the creation of the heavens and earth, and the alternation of the night and the day, and the [great] ships which sail through the sea with that which benefits people, and what Allah has sent down from the heavens of rain, giving life thereby to the earth after its lifelessness and dispersing therein every [kind of] moving creature, and [His] directing of the winds and the clouds controlled between the heaven and the earth are signs for a people who use reason.
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
وأشار إلى تفصيله فى مواضع شتى حيث قال تعالى والسحاب المسخر بين السماء والأرض وحيث تعرض للرعد والبرق والسحاب والمطر
Indeed, I have pointed to its detailed exposition in various places, where He, the Exalted, said: "And the clouds [al-sahab] compelled [al-musakhkhar] between the heaven and the earth," and where He presented the thunder [al-ra'd], the lightning [al-barq], the clouds [al-sahab], and the rain [al-matar].

a.g: And [yet], among the people are those who take other than Allah as equals [to Him]. They love them as they [should] love Allah. But those who believe are stronger in love for Allah. And if only they who have wronged would consider [that] when they see the punishment, [they will be certain] that all power belongs to Allah and that Allah is severe in punishment.
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
وَدَلَّ عَلَى إِثْبَاتِ الْحُبِّ لِلَّهِ تَعَالَى قَوْلُهُ عَزَّ وَجَلَّ "يُحِبُّهُمْ وَيُحِبُّونَهُ" وَقَوْلُهُ تَعَالَى "وَالَّذِينَ آمَنُوا أَشَدُّ حُبًّا لِلَّهِ" وَهُوَ دَلِيلٌ عَلَى إِثْبَاتِ الْحُبِّ وَإِثْبَاتِ التَّفَاوُتِ فِيهِ.
And He points to the affirmation of love [hubb] for Allah, exalted is He, by His saying, mighty and majestic is He: "He loves them and they love Him," and by His saying, exalted is He: "And those who believe are more intense in love [hubb] for Allah." And this is a proof for the affirmation of love [hubb] and the affirmation of its varying degrees [tafawut] therein.

a.g: [And they should consider that] when those who have been followed disassociate themselves from those who followed [them], and they [all] see the punishment, and cut off from them are the ties [of relationship],

Those who followed will say, "If only we had another turn [at worldly life] so we could disassociate ourselves from them as they have disassociated themselves from us." Thus will Allah show them their deeds as regrets upon them. And they are never to emerge from the Fire.
O mankind, eat from whatever is on earth [that is] lawful and good and do not follow the footsteps of Satan. Indeed, he is to you a clear enemy.
He only orders you to evil and immorality and to say about Allah what you do not know.

And when it is said to them, "Follow what Allah has revealed," they say, "Rather, we will follow that which we found our fathers doing." Even though their fathers understood nothing, nor were they guided?
The example of those who disbelieve is like that of one who shouts at what hears nothing but calls and cries cattle or sheep - deaf, dumb and blind, so they do not understand.
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
فإن كان القرآن لا يؤثر فيه أصلا ف مثله كمثل الذي ينعق بما لا يسمع إلا دعاء ونداء صم بكم عمي فهم لا يعقلون
Indeed, if the Qur'an has no effect upon him at all, then his likeness is like one who calls out to that which hears nothing but a call and a cry. Deaf, dumb, blind—they do not comprehend.

a.g: O you who have believed, eat from the good things which We have provided for you and be grateful to Allah if it is [indeed] Him that you worship.
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
وقال إن الله تعالى أمر المؤمنين بما أمر به المرسلين فقال يا أيها الذين آمنوا كلوا من طيبات ما رزقناكم حديث إن الله أمر المؤمنين بما أمر به المرسلين الحديث أخرجه مسلم من حديث أبي هريرة فسأل النبي صلى الله عليه وسلم عن أصل الشيء وأصل أصله ولم يزد لأن ما وراء ذلك يتعذر وسنبين في كتاب الحلال والحرام موضع وجوب هذا السؤال
Indeed, Allah the Exalted commanded the believers with what He commanded the messengers, saying: "O you who have believed, eat from the good things [ṭayyibāt] which We have provided for you." The ḥadīth: "Indeed, Allah commanded the believers with what He commanded the messengers" – the ḥadīth was narrated by Muslim from the ḥadīth of Abū Hurayrah. So the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, asked about the origin [aṣl] of the thing and the origin of its origin, and he did not go beyond that, for what lies beyond that becomes impossible. And We will clarify in the Book of the Lawful and the Prohibited the place of the obligation of this question.

a.g: He has only forbidden to you dead animals, blood, the flesh of swine, and that which has been dedicated to other than Allah. But whoever is forced [by necessity], neither desiring [it] nor transgressing [its limit], there is no sin upon him. Indeed, Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.

Indeed, they who conceal what Allah has sent down of the Book and exchange it for a small price - those consume not into their bellies except the Fire. And Allah will not speak to them on the Day of Resurrection, nor will He purify them. And they will have a painful punishment.
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
أما بعد: فإن الدنيا عدوة لله وعدوة لأولياء الله وعدوة لأعداء الله. أما عداوتها لله فإنها قطعت الطريق على عباد الله. ولذلك لم ينظر الله إليها منذ خلقها. وأما عداوتها لأولياء الله عز وجل: فإنها تزينت لهم بزينتها وعمتهم بزهرتها ونضارتها حتى تجرعوا مرارة الصبر في مقاطعتها. وأما عداوتها لأعداء الله: فإنها استدرجتهم بمكرها وكيدها فاقتنصتهم بشبكتها حتى وثقوا بها. وعولوا عليها فخذلتهم أحوج ما كانوا إليها. فاجتنوا منها حسرة تتقطع دونها الأكباد. ثم حرمتهم السعادة أبد الآباد. فهم على فراقها يتحسرون ومن مكايدها يستغيثون ولا يغاثون. بل يقال لهم "اخسئوا فيها ولا تكلمون. أولئك الذين اشتروا الحياة الدنيا بالآخرة فلا يخفف عنهم العذاب ولا هم ينصرون".
Indeed, as for what follows: The world [al-dunya] is an enemy to Allah, and an enemy to the allies [awliya'] of Allah, and an enemy to the enemies of Allah. As for its enmity to Allah: It has cut off the path [al-tariq] from the servants of Allah. And for that reason, Allah has not looked upon it since He created it. And as for its enmity to the allies [awliya'] of Allah, the Mighty and Majestic: It adorned itself for them with its adornment, and blinded them with its splendor and freshness, until they drank the bitterness of patience [al-sabr] in severing ties with it. And as for its enmity to the enemies of Allah: It gradually lured them with its guile and its plot, then snatched them with its net, until they placed their trust in it and relied upon it. Then it abandoned them at the time of their greatest need for it. So they reaped from it a regret [hasra] that causes hearts [al-akbad] to be torn apart. Then it deprived them of felicity [al-sa'ada] for all eternity. They are in separation from it, regretful, and from its plots they cry for help, but they are not given succor. Rather, it is said to them: "Be driven into it, and do not speak to Me. Those are the ones who purchased the worldly life [al-hayat al-dunya] with the Hereafter [al-akhira]; so the punishment will not be lightened for them, nor will they be helped."

a.g: Those are the ones who have exchanged guidance for error and forgiveness for punishment. How patient they are in pursuit of the Fire!
That is [deserved by them] because Allah has sent down the Book in truth. And indeed, those who differ over the Book are in extreme dissension.

Righteousness is not that you turn your faces toward the east or the west, but [true] righteousness is [in] one who believes in Allah, the Last Day, the angels, the Book, and the prophets and gives wealth, in spite of love for it, to relatives, orphans, the needy, the traveler, those who ask [for help], and for freeing slaves; [and who] establishes prayer and gives zakah; [those who] fulfill their promise when they promise; and [those who] are patient in poverty and hardship and during battle. Those are the ones who have been true, and it is those who are the righteous.
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
واعلم أن الصبر ضربان: أحدهما ضرب بدني كتحمل المشاق بالبدن والثبات عليها وهو إما بالفعل كتعاطي الأعمال الشاقة إما من العبادات أو من غيرها واما بالاحتمال كالصبر على الضرب الشديد والمرض العظيم والجراحات الهائلة وذلك قد يكون محمودا إذا وافق الشرع ولكن المحمود التام هو الضرب الآخر وهو الصبر النفسي عن مشتهيات الطبع ومقتضيات الهوى ثم هذا الضرب إن كان صبرا على شهوة البطن والفرج سمى عفة وإن كان على احتمال مكروه اختلفت أساميه عند الناس باختلاف المكروه الذي غلب عليه الصبر فإن كان في مصيبة اقتصر على اسم الصبر وتضاده حالة تسمى الجزع والهلع وهو إطلاق داعي الهوى ليسترسل في رفع الصوت وضرب الخدود وشق الجيوب وغيرهما وإن كان في احتمال الغنى سمى ضبط النفس وتضاده حالة تسمى البطر وإن كان في حرب ومقاتلة سمى شجاعة ويضاده الجبن وإن كان في كظم الغيظ والغضب سمى حلما ويضاده التذمر وإن كان في نائبة من نوائب الزمان مضجرة سمى سعة الصدر ويضاده الضجر والتبرم وضيق الصدر وإن كان في إخفاء كلام سمي كتمان السر وسمي صاحبه كتوما وإن كان عن فضول العيش سمى زهدا ويضاده الحرص وإن كان صبرا على قدر يسير من الحظوظ سمي قناعة ويضاده الشره فأكثر أخلاق الإيمان داخل في الصبر ولذلك لما سئل عليه السلام مرة عن الإيمان قال: (هو الصبر) لأنه كثر أعماله وأعزها كما قال: (احج عرفة) وقد جمع الله تعالى أقسام ذلك وسمى الكل صبرا فقال تعالى: ﴿ والصابرين في البأساء ﴾ {} أي المصيبة ﴿ والضراء ﴾ {} أي الفقر ﴿ وحين البأس ﴾ {} أي المحاربة ﴿ اولئك الذين صدقوا وأولئك هم المتقون ﴾ {} فإذن هذه أقسام الصبر باختلاف متعلقاتها.
Know that patience [sabr] is of two kinds. The first is a bodily kind, such as enduring hardships with the body and remaining steadfast upon them. This is either through action, such as undertaking strenuous works, whether from acts of worship or otherwise, or through endurance, such as patience [sabr] with severe beating, great illness, and terrible wounds. This can be praiseworthy if it conforms to the Sacred Law, but the complete praiseworthy kind is the other kind, which is the patience [sabr] of the soul [nafs] from the desires of one's nature and the demands of caprice [hawa]. Then, this kind, if it is patience [sabr] against the desire of the stomach and the private parts, it is called chastity ['iffa]. If it is in enduring a disliked thing, its names differ among people according to the difference of the disliked thing which patience [sabr] has overcome. If it is in a calamity, it is confined to the name 'patience' [sabr], and its opposite state is called panic [jaza'] and alarm [hala'], which is releasing the caller of caprice [hawa] to give free rein in raising the voice, striking the cheeks, tearing the collars, and other such acts. If it is in enduring wealth, it is called self-restraint [dabt al-nafs], and its opposite state is called arrogance [batr]. If it is in war and fighting, it is called courage [shaja'a], and its opposite is cowardice [jubn]. If it is in suppressing rage and anger, it is called forbearance [hilm], and its opposite is complaint [tadammur]. If it is in an afflicting calamity from the calamities of time, it is called breadth of the chest [sa'at al-sadr], and its opposite is impatience [dajar] and vexation [tabarram] and narrowness of the chest [dayq al-sadr]. If it is in concealing speech, it is called keeping a secret [kitman al-sirr], and its possessor is called secretive [katum]. If it is from the excesses of life, it is called renunciation [zuhd], and its opposite is greed [hirs]. If it is patience [sabr] upon a small portion of shares, it is called contentment [qana'a], and its opposite is avarice [sharah]. Thus, most of the character traits of faith [iman] are included within patience [sabr]. For this reason, when He, peace be upon him, was once asked about faith [iman], he said: "It is patience [sabr]," because its acts are many and most noble, just as He said: "Perform Hajj at 'Arafah." And Allah, the Exalted, has gathered all these divisions and named the whole of it 'patience' [sabr], saying, the Exalted: "And those who are patient [al-sabirin] in poverty [al-ba'sa']" – meaning calamity – "and hardship [al-darra']" – meaning poverty – "and when in battle [hina al-ba's]" – meaning warfare – "It is they who have been true, and it is they who are the righteous [al-muttaqun]." Therefore, these are the divisions of patience [sabr] according to the differences of their objects.

a.g: O you who have believed, prescribed for you is legal retribution for those murdered - the free for the free, the slave for the slave, and the female for the female. But whoever overlooks from his brother anything, then there should be a suitable follow-up and payment to him with good conduct. This is an alleviation from your Lord and a mercy. But whoever transgresses after that will have a painful punishment.
And there is for you in legal retribution [saving of] life, O you [people] of understanding, that you may become righteous.

Prescribed for you when death approaches [any] one of you if he leaves wealth [is that he should make] a bequest for the parents and near relatives according to what is acceptable - a duty upon the righteous.
Then whoever alters the bequest after he has heard it - the sin is only upon those who have altered it. Indeed, Allah is Hearing and Knowing.
But if one fears from the bequeather [some] error or sin and corrects that which is between them, there is no sin upon him. Indeed, Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.
O you who have believed, decreed upon you is fasting as it was decreed upon those before you that you may become righteous -

[Fasting for] a limited number of days. So whoever among you is ill or on a journey [during them] - then an equal number of days [are to be made up]. And upon those who are able [to fast, but with hardship] - a ransom [as substitute] of feeding a poor person [each day]. And whoever volunteers excess - it is better for him. But to fast is best for you, if you only knew.

The month of Ramadhan [is that] in which was revealed the Qur'an, a guidance for the people and clear proofs of guidance and criterion. So whoever sights [the new moon of] the month, let him fast it; and whoever is ill or on a journey - then an equal number of other days. Allah intends for you ease and does not intend for you hardship and [wants] for you to complete the period and to glorify Allah for that [to] which He has guided you; and perhaps you will be grateful.
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
ومنها التدريج في البيان كقوله عز وجل ﴿ شهر رمضان الذي أنزل فيه القرآن ﴾ إذ لم يظهر به أنه ليل أو نهار وبان بقوله عز وجل ﴿ إنا أنزلناه في ليلة مباركة ﴾ ولم يظهر به أي ليلة فظهر بقوله تعالى ﴿ إنا أنزلناه في ليلة القدر ﴾.
And from them is the gradual unfolding in clarification [al-tadrij fi al-bayan], as in His, the Mighty and Majestic, saying: "The month of Ramadan [shahr Ramadan] in which the Qur'an was sent down [unzila fihi al-Qur'an]" — for it was not made apparent by this whether it was night or day. Then it became clear by His, the Mighty and Majestic, saying: "Indeed, We sent it down on a blessed night [layla mubaraka]" — yet it was not made apparent by this which night it was. Then it became manifest by His, the Exalted's, saying: "Indeed, We sent it down on the Night of Decree [laylat al-qadr]."

a.g: And when My servants ask you, [O Muhammad], concerning Me - indeed I am near. I respond to the invocation of the supplicant when he calls upon Me. So let them respond to Me [by obedience] and believe in Me that they may be [rightly] guided.
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
قال الله تعالى: ﴿ وإذا سألك عبادي عني فإني قريب أجيب دعوة الداع إذا دعان فليستجيبوا لي ﴾ ورغبهم في السؤال والدعاء بأمره فقال: ﴿ ادعوني أستجب لكم ﴾ فأطمع المطيع والعاصي والداني والقاصي في الانبساط إلى حضرة جلاله برفع الحاجات والأماني بقوله: ﴿ فإني قريب أجيب دعوة الداع إذا دعان ﴾
Indeed, in His saying, the Most High: "For indeed, I am near [qarīb]; I respond to the call of the caller when he calls upon Me." And blessings upon Muhammad, the master of His prophets, and upon his family and his companions, the chosen of His pure ones, and abundant peace. [Now to proceed]: There is no act of worship performed by the tongue after the recitation of the Book of God, the Mighty and Majestic, better than the remembrance of God [dhikr Allāh], the Most High, and the raising of needs through supplications [duʿāʾ] made sincerely to God, the Most High. Therefore, it is necessary to explain the virtue of remembrance [faḍīlat al-dhikr] in general, then in detail regarding specific remembrances, and to explain the virtue of supplication, its conditions, its etiquettes, and to transmit the reported comprehensive supplications for the objectives of religion [dīn] and the worldly life [dunyā], and the specific supplications for seeking forgiveness [maghfirah] and seeking refuge and others. And the intended purpose of this will be clarified by mentioning five chapters.

a.g: It has been made permissible for you the night preceding fasting to go to your wives [for sexual relations]. They are clothing for you and you are clothing for them. Allah knows that you used to deceive yourselves, so He accepted your repentance and forgave you. So now, have relations with them and seek that which Allah has decreed for you. And eat and drink until the white thread of dawn becomes distinct to you from the black thread [of night]. Then complete the fast until the sunset. And do not have relations with them as long as you are staying for worship in the mosques. These are the limits [set by] Allah, so do not approach them. Thus does Allah make clear His ordinances to the people that they may become righteous.

And do not consume one another's wealth unjustly or send it [in bribery] to the rulers in order that [they might aid] you [to] consume a portion of the wealth of the people in sin, while you know [it is unlawful].
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
وقال تعالى ولا تأكلوا أموالكم بينكم بالباطل وقال تعالى إن الذين يأكلون أموال اليتامى ظلما الآية وقال تعالى يا أيها الذين آمنوا اتقوا الله وذروا ما بقي من الربا إن كنتم مؤمنين ثم قال فإن لم تفعلوا فأذنوا بحرب من الله ورسوله ثم قال وإن تبتم فلكم رءوس أموالكم ثم قال ومن عاد فأولئك أصحاب النار هم فيها خالدون جعل آكل الربا أول الأمر مؤذنا بمحاربة الله وفي آخره متعرضا للنار والآيات الواردة في الحلال والحرام لا تحصى.
Indeed, the Most High has said: "And do not consume your wealth [amwalakum] among yourselves unjustly [bil-batil]." And the Most High has said: "Indeed, those who consume the wealth of orphans unjustly..." And the Most High has said: "O you who have believed, fear Allah [ittaqullah] and give up what remains [of interest] if you should be believers." Then He said: "But if you do not, then be informed of a war [harb] from Allah and His Messenger." Then He said: "And if you repent, then for you are your principal sums." Then He said: "And whoever returns [to dealing in interest] – those are the companions of the Fire; they will abide therein eternally." He made the consumer of interest [akil al-riba], at the beginning of the matter, one who announces war [mu'dhin bi harb], and at its end, one who exposes himself to the Fire [mut'arrid lil-nar]. And the verses revealed concerning the lawful [al-halal] and the unlawful [al-haram] are beyond count.

a.g: They ask you, [O Muhammad], about the new moons. Say, "They are measurements of time for the people and for Hajj." And it is not righteousness to enter houses from the back, but righteousness is [in] one who fears Allah. And enter houses from their doors. And fear Allah that you may succeed.
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
وقد أوردناها في كتاب آداب الصحبة وكذلك ما روي أن عمر رضي الله عنه تسلق دار رجل فرآه على حالة مكروهة فأنكر عليه فقال يا أمير المؤمنين إن كنت أنا قد عصيت الله من وجه واحد فأنت قد عصيته من ثلاثة أوجه فقال وما هي فقال قد قال تعالى ولا تجسسوا وقد تجسست وقال تعالى وأتوا البيوت من أبوابها وقد تسورت من السطح وقال لا تدخلوا بيوتا غير بيوتكم حتى تستأنسوا وتسلموا على أهلها وما سلمت فتركه عمر وشرط عليه التوبة.
Indeed, We have mentioned this in the Book of the Etiquettes of Companionship. And likewise, what has been narrated: that 'Umar, may God be pleased with him, climbed over the wall of a man's house and saw him in a reprehensible state, so he reproached him. The man said, "O Commander of the Faithful, if I have disobeyed God in one respect, you have disobeyed Him in three." He said, "And what are they?" He said, "Indeed, God the Exalted has said, 'And do not spy [wa la tajassasu],' and you have spied. And He the Exalted has said, 'And enter houses from their doors [wa'tu al-buyuta min abwabiha],' and you have scaled the roof. And He said, 'Do not enter houses other than your own until you have announced yourselves and greeted the people therein [hatta tasta'nisu wa tusallimu 'ala ahliha],' and you did not greet." So 'Umar left him and stipulated upon him repentance.

a.g: Fight in the way of Allah those who fight you but do not transgress. Indeed. Allah does not like transgressors.

And kill them wherever you overtake them and expel them from wherever they have expelled you, and fitnah is worse than killing. And do not fight them at al-Masjid al- Haram until they fight you there. But if they fight you, then kill them. Such is the recompense of the disbelievers.
And if they cease, then indeed, Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.
Fight them until there is no [more] fitnah and [until] worship is [acknowledged to be] for Allah. But if they cease, then there is to be no aggression except against the oppressors.

[Fighting in] the sacred month is for [aggression committed in] the sacred month, and for [all] violations is legal retribution. So whoever has assaulted you, then assault him in the same way that he has assaulted you. And fear Allah and know that Allah is with those who fear Him.
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
وقال تعالى: (واتقوا الله واعلموا( (البقرة: 194). وقال تعالى: (واتقوا الله ويعلمكم الله( (البقرة: 282) وقال تعالى: (واتقوا الله واعلموا( (البقرة: 194) (واتقوا الله واسمعوا( (المائدة: 108).
Indeed, fear Allah [ittaqū Allāh] and know [wa i'lamū] (Al-Baqarah: 194). And He, the Exalted, said: "And fear Allah, and Allah teaches you [wa yu'allimukumu Allāh]" (Al-Baqarah: 282). And He, the Exalted, said: "And fear Allah and know [wa i'lamū]" (Al-Baqarah: 194) and "And fear Allah and listen [wa isma'ū]" (Al-Ma'idah: 108).

a.g: And spend in the way of Allah and do not throw [yourselves] with your [own] hands into destruction [by refraining]. And do good; indeed, Allah loves the doers of good.

Indeed, if you say: "This is striving towards destruction [halak] and casting the soul [nafs] into ruin [tahluka]," then know that this exits from being forbidden [haram] by two conditions: The first is that the man has disciplined his soul [nafs] and struggled against it and accustomed it to patience [sabr] regarding food for a week or what is close to it, to the extent that he endures it without constriction of the heart [qalb], disturbance of the inner state [khatir], or difficulty in the remembrance [dhikr] of God, the Exalted.

a.g: And complete the Hajj and 'umrah for Allah. But if you are prevented, then [offer] what can be obtained with ease of sacrificial animals. And do not shave your heads until the sacrificial animal has reached its place of slaughter. And whoever among you is ill or has an ailment of the head [making shaving necessary must offer] a ransom of fasting [three days] or charity or sacrifice. And when you are secure, then whoever performs 'umrah [during the Hajj months] followed by Hajj [offers] what can be obtained with ease of sacrificial animals. And whoever cannot find [or afford such an animal] - then a fast of three days during Hajj and of seven when you have returned [home]. Those are ten complete [days]. This is for those whose family is not in the area of al-Masjid al-Haram. And fear Allah and know that Allah is severe in penalty.
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
وقاله عمر وعلي وابن مسعود رضي الله عنهم في معنى قوله عز وجل - وإتموا الحج والعمرة لله - ولم يحج مع اليسار فأمره شديد عند الله تعالى قال عمر رضي الله عنه لقد هممت أن أكتب في الأمصار بضرب الجزية على من لم يحج ممن يستطيع إليه سبيلا وعن سعيد بن جبير وإبراهيم النخعي ومجاهد وطاوس لو علمت رجلا غنيا وجب عليه الحج ثم مات قبل أن يحج ما صليت عليه وبعضهم كان له جار موسر فمات ولم يحج فلم يصل عليه وكان ابن عباس يقول: من مات ولم يزك ولم يحج سأل الرجعة إلى الدنيا وقرأ قوله عز وجل: ﴿ رب ارجعون لعلي أعمل صالحا فيما تركت ﴾ {} قال: الحج.
Indeed, 'Umar, 'Ali, and Ibn Mas'ud—may God be pleased with them—said concerning the meaning of His Mighty and Majestic statement, *"And complete the Hajj and 'Umrah for God"*: Whoever does not perform the Hajj [hajj] despite having the means [yusra], his affair is severe with God, Exalted is He. 'Umar—may God be pleased with him—said: "I was resolved to write to the provinces to impose the poll-tax [jizya] upon whoever does not perform the Hajj from among those who are capable [yastati'] of the way to it." And from Sa'id ibn Jubayr, Ibrahim al-Nakha'i, Mujahid, and Tawus: "If I knew of a wealthy man upon whom the Hajj was obligatory, then he died before performing it, I would not pray over him." And some of them had a wealthy neighbor who died without having performed the Hajj, so he did not pray over him. And Ibn 'Abbas used to say: "Whoever dies without having given the alms [zakat] and without having performed the Hajj will ask to be returned to the world [dunya]," and he recited His Mighty and Majestic statement: *"My Lord, return me, that I may do righteous work in what I left behind"* (23:99-100). He said: "The Hajj."

a.g: Hajj is [during] well-known months, so whoever has made Hajj obligatory upon himself therein [by entering the state of ihram], there is [to be for him] no sexual relations and no disobedience and no disputing during Hajj. And whatever good you do - Allah knows it. And take provisions, but indeed, the best provision is fear of Allah. And fear Me, O you of understanding.

There is no blame upon you for seeking bounty from your Lord [during Hajj]. But when you depart from 'Arafat, remember Allah at al- Mash'ar al-Haram. And remember Him, as He has guided you, for indeed, you were before that among those astray.
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
وقال تعالى: ليس عليكم جناح أن تبتغوا فضلا من ربكم.
Indeed, there is no blame upon you that you seek bounty [fadl] from your Lord.

a.g: Then depart from the place from where [all] the people depart and ask forgiveness of Allah. Indeed, Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.

And when you have completed your rites, remember Allah like your [previous] remembrance of your fathers or with [much] greater remembrance. And among the people is he who says, "Our Lord, give us in this world," and he will have in the Hereafter no share.
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
وقال عز وجل: ﴿ فإذا قضيتم مناسككم فاذكروا الله كذكركم آباءكم أو أشد ذكرا ﴾ {}
Indeed, when you have completed your rites [manāsik], then remember Allah [Allāh] as you remember your fathers, or with a more intense remembrance [dhikr].

a.g: But among them is he who says, "Our Lord, give us in this world [that which is] good and in the Hereafter [that which is] good and protect us from the punishment of the Fire."
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
لعلك تقول هذه الأخبار تدل على أن البلاء خير في الدنيا من النعم فهل لنا أن نسأل الله البلاء. فأقول لا وجه لذلك لما روى عن رسول الله ﭬ (أنه كان يستعيذ في دعائه من بلاء الدنيا وبلاء الآخرة[107]) وكان يقول هو والأنبياء عليهم السلام (ربنا آتنا في الدنيا حسنة وفي الآخرة حسنة[108]) وكانوا يستعيذون من شماتة الأعداء وغيرها[109]. وقال على كرم الله وجهه اللهم إنى أسألك الصبر فقال ﭬ: (لقد سألت البلاء فاسأله العافية[110]) وروى الصديق رضى الله تعالى عنه عن رسول الله ﭬ أنه قال: (سلوا الله العافية فما أعطى أحد أفضل من العافية إلا اليقين[111]) وأشار باليقين إلى عافية القلب عن مرض الجهل والشك فعافية القلب أعلى من عافية البدن. وقال الحسن رحمه الله الخير الذى لا شر فيه العافية مع الشكر فكم من منعم عليه غير شاكر. وقال مطرف بن عبد الله لأن أعافى فأشكر أحب إلي من أن أبتلى فأصبر وقال ﭬ في دعائه (وعافيتك أحب إلي[112]) وهذا أظهر من أن يحتاج فيه إلى دليل واستشهاد وهذا لأن البلاء صار نعمة باعتبارين: أحدهما بالإضافة إلى ما هو أكثر منه إما في الدنيا أو في الدين، والآخر بالإضافة إلى ما يرجى من الثواب فينبغى أن نسأل الله تمام النعمة في الدنيا ودفع ما فوقه من البلاء ونسأله الثواب في الآخرة على الشكر على نعمته فإنه قادر على أن يعطى على الشكر ما لا يعطيه على الصبر.
Perhaps you say: "These reports indicate that tribulation [bala'] is better in this world [dunya] than blessings [ni'am]. So, is it for us to ask Allah for tribulation?" I say: There is no basis for that, because it is narrated from the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, that he would seek refuge in his supplication from the tribulation of this world and the tribulation of the Hereafter [akhira]. And he, and the Prophets, peace be upon them, would say: "Our Lord, grant us good in this world and good in the Hereafter." And they would seek refuge from the gloating of enemies and other things. And 'Ali, may Allah honor his face, said: "O Allah, I ask You for patience [sabr]." So the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "You have asked for tribulation, so ask Him for well-being ['afiya]." And it is narrated from al-Siddiq, may Allah be pleased with him, from the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, that he said: "Ask Allah for well-being, for no one has been given anything better than well-being except certainty [yaqin]." And he indicated by 'certainty' the well-being of the heart [qalb] from the sickness of ignorance [jahl] and doubt [shakk]. So the well-being of the heart is higher than the well-being of the body. And al-Hasan, may Allah have mercy on him, said: "The good in which there is no evil is well-being with gratitude [shukr], for how many are those upon whom blessings are bestowed who are not grateful." And Mutarrif ibn 'Abdullah said: "That I be granted well-being and be grateful is more beloved to me than that I be afflicted and be patient." And the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, said in his supplication: "And Your well-being is more beloved to me." This is clearer than to need proof and evidence for it. And this is because tribulation becomes a blessing [ni'ma] by two considerations: One of them is in relation to what is greater than it, either in this world or in religion [din]. And the other is in relation to what is hoped for of reward [thawab]. Therefore, we should ask Allah for the perfection of blessing in this world and the removal of what is beyond it of tribulation. And we ask Him for reward in the Hereafter for gratitude [shukr] for His blessing, for He is capable of granting for gratitude what He does not grant for patience.

a.g: Those will have a share of what they have earned, and Allah is swift in account.

And remember Allah during [specific] numbered days. Then whoever hastens [his departure] in two days - there is no sin upon him; and whoever delays [until the third] - there is no sin upon him - for him who fears Allah. And fear Allah and know that unto Him you will be gathered.

a.g: And of the people is he whose speech pleases you in worldly life, and he calls Allah to witness as to what is in his heart, yet he is the fiercest of opponents.
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
وهو الذي ذكره الله تعالى في كتابه في مواضع شتى كقوله عز وجل "ومن الناس من يعجبك قوله في الحياة الدنيا ويشهد الله على ما في قلبه وهو ألد الخصام وإذا تولى سعى في الأرض ليفسد فيها" الآية.
Indeed, He is the one whom God the Exalted has mentioned in His Book in various places, such as His Mighty and Majestic saying: "And among the people is he whose speech pleases you in the life of this world [al-dunya], and he calls God to witness what is in his heart [qalb], yet he is the fiercest of adversaries. And when he turns away, he strives upon the earth to cause corruption therein..." the verse.

a.g: And when he goes away, he strives throughout the land to cause corruption therein and destroy crops and animals. And Allah does not like corruption.
And when it is said to him, "Fear Allah," pride in the sin takes hold of him. Sufficient for him is Hellfire, and how wretched is the resting place.
And of the people is he who sells himself, seeking means to the approval of Allah. And Allah is kind to [His] servants.
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
وَبَاتَ عَلِيٌّ كَرَّمَ اللَّهُ وَجْهَهُ عَلَى فِرَاشِ رَسُولِ اللَّهِ ﷺ فَأَوْحَى اللَّهُ تَعَالَى إِلَى جِبْرِيلَ وَمِيكَائِيلَ عَلَيْهِمَا السَّلَامُ: إِنِّي آخَيْتُ بَيْنَكُمَا وَجَعَلْتُ عُمْرَ أَحَدِكُمَا أَطْوَلَ مِنْ عُمْرِ الْآخَرِ فَأَيُّكُمَا يُؤْثِرُ صَاحِبَهُ بِالْحَيَاةِ؟ فَاخْتَارَا كِلَاهُمَا الْحَيَاةَ وَأَحَبَّاهَا؛ فَأَوْحَى اللَّهُ عَزَّ وَجَلَّ إِلَيْهِمَا أَفَلَا كُنْتُمَا مِثْلَ عَلِيِّ بْنِ أَبِي طَالِبٍ آخَيْتُ بَيْنَهُ وَبَيْنَ نَبِيِّي مُحَمَّدٍ ﷺ فَبَاتَ عَلَى فِرَاشِهِ يُفْدِيهِ بِنَفْسِهِ وَيُؤْثِرُهُ بِالْحَيَاةِ؟ اهْبِطَا إِلَى الْأَرْضِ فَاحْفَظَاهُ مِنْ عَدُوِّهِ فَكَانَ جِبْرِيلُ عِنْدَ رَأْسِهِ وَمِيكَائِيلُ عِنْدَ رِجْلَيْهِ وَجِبْرِيلُ عَلَيْهِ السَّلَامُ يَقُولُ: بَخْ بَخْ مَنْ مِثْلَكَ يَا بْنَ أَبِي طَالِبٍ وَاللَّهُ تَعَالَى يُبَاهِي بِكَ الْمَلَائِكَةَ! فَأَنْزَلَ اللَّهُ تَعَالَى "وَمِنَ النَّاسِ مَنْ يَشْرِي نَفْسَهُ ابْتِغَاءَ مَرْضَاتِ اللَّهِ وَاللَّهُ رَءُوفٌ بِالْعِبَادِ".
And 'Ali, may God honor his face, slept upon the bed of the Messenger of God ﷺ. So God, the Exalted, revealed to Gabriel and Michael, peace be upon them both: "Indeed, I have made brotherhood between you two and made the life [al-hayah] of one of you longer than the life of the other. So which of you would prefer his companion with life [al-hayah]?" So they both chose life [al-hayah] and loved it. So God, Mighty and Majestic, revealed to them: "Would you not be like 'Ali ibn Abi Talib? I made brotherhood between him and My Prophet Muhammad ﷺ, so he slept upon his bed, ransoming him with his own soul [nafs] and preferring him with life [al-hayah]. Descend to the earth and protect him from his enemy." So Gabriel was at his head and Michael was at his feet, and Gabriel, peace be upon him, was saying: "Excellent, excellent! Who is like you, O son of Abi Talib, while God, the Exalted, boasts of you to the angels!" So God, the Exalted, revealed: "And among the people is he who sells his soul [nafs] seeking the pleasure of God; and God is Kind to the servants."

a.g: O you who have believed, enter into Islam completely [and perfectly] and do not follow the footsteps of Satan. Indeed, he is to you a clear enemy.
But if you deviate after clear proofs have come to you, then know that Allah is Exalted in Might and Wise.
Do they await but that Allah should come to them in covers of clouds and the angels [as well] and the matter is [then] decided? And to Allah [all] matters are returned.
Ask the Children of Israel how many a sign of evidence We have given them. And whoever exchanges the favor of Allah [for disbelief] after it has come to him - then indeed, Allah is severe in penalty.

Beautified for those who disbelieve is the life of this world, and they ridicule those who believe. But those who fear Allah are above them on the Day of Resurrection. And Allah gives provision to whom He wills without account.

Mankind was [of] one religion [before their deviation]; then Allah sent the prophets as bringers of good tidings and warners and sent down with them the Scripture in truth to judge between the people concerning that in which they differed. And none differed over the Scripture except those who were given it - after the clear proofs came to them - out of jealous animosity among themselves. And Allah guided those who believed to the truth concerning that over which they had differed, by His permission. And Allah guides whom He wills to a straight path.
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
وقال تعالى "كان الناس أمة واحدة" إلى قوله "إلا الذين أوتوه من بعد ما جاءتهم البينات بغياً بينهم" قيل في التفسير: حسداً. وقال تعالى "وما تفرقوا إلا من بعد ما جاءهم العلم بغياً بينهم" فأنزل الله العلم ليجمعهم ويؤلف بينهم على طاعته، وأمرهم أن يتألفوا بالعلم فتحاسدوا واختلفوا إذ أراد كل واحد منهم أن ينفرد بالرياسة وقبول القول فرد بعضهم على بعض. قال ابن عباس: كانت اليهود قبل أن يبعث النبي ﷺ إذا قاتلوا قوماً قالوا نسألك بالنبي الذي وعدتنا أن ترسله وبالكتاب الذي تنزله إلا ما نصرتنا. فكانوا ينصرون. فلما جاء النبي ﷺ من ولد إسماعيل عليه السلام عرفوه وكفروا به بعد معرفتهم إياه فقال تعالى "وكانوا من يقبل يستفتحون على الذين كفروا فلما جاءهم ما عرفوا كفروا به" إلى قوله "أن يكفروا بما أنزل الله بغياً" أي حسداً.
Indeed, Allah the Exalted said, "Mankind was one community [umma wahida]..." up to His saying, "...except those to whom it was given after the clear proofs had come to them, out of envy [baghyan] among themselves." It is said in the interpretation: out of envy [hasadan]. And He the Exalted said, "And they did not become divided except after knowledge [al-'ilm] had come to them, out of envy [baghyan] among themselves." So Allah sent down knowledge [al-'ilm] to gather them and unite them upon obedience to Him, and He commanded them to unite through knowledge [al-'ilm], yet they envied one another and differed when each one of them desired to be singled out for leadership [ri'asa] and for the acceptance of his saying, so they began to refute one another. Ibn 'Abbas said: The Jews, before the Prophet ﷺ was sent, when they fought a people, would say, 'We ask you by the Prophet you have promised to send and by the Book you will reveal, that you grant us victory.' And they would be granted victory. So when the Prophet ﷺ came from the progeny of Ishmael, peace be upon him, they recognized him and disbelieved in him after their recognition [ma'rifa] of him. Therefore, Allah the Exalted said, "And they had been, before, praying for victory over those who disbelieved, but when there came to them that which they recognized [ma'rifa], they disbelieved in it..." up to His saying, "...that they disbelieve in what Allah has revealed out of envy [baghyan]," meaning, out of envy [hasadan].

a.g: Or do you think that you will enter Paradise while such [trial] has not yet come to you as came to those who passed on before you? They were touched by poverty and hardship and were shaken until [even their] messenger and those who believed with him said, "When is the help of Allah?" Unquestionably, the help of Allah is near.

They ask you, [O Muhammad], what they should spend. Say, "Whatever you spend of good is [to be] for parents and relatives and orphans and the needy and the traveler. And whatever you do of good - indeed, Allah is Knowing of it."

Fighting has been enjoined upon you while it is hateful to you. But perhaps you hate a thing and it is good for you; and perhaps you love a thing and it is bad for you. And Allah Knows, while you know not.

Tafsir Al-Ihya
ومهما لم ير المحب إلا المحبوب ولم ير شيئاً إلا منه لم يتأسف ولم يشك واستقبل الكل بالرضا وعلم أن المحبوب لم يقدر له إلا ما فيه خيرته، ويذكر قوله: " وعسى أن تكرهوا شيئاً وهو خير لكم ".
And whenever the lover [al-muhibb] sees nothing but the Beloved [al-mahbub] and sees nothing except from Him, he does not grieve nor does he doubt, and he meets all things with contentment [rida], knowing that the Beloved has not decreed for him except what contains his good. And he remembers His saying: "And perhaps you dislike a thing, and it is good for you."

a.g: They ask you about the sacred month - about fighting therein. Say, "Fighting therein is great [sin], but averting [people] from the way of Allah and disbelief in Him and [preventing access to] al-Masjid al-Haram and the expulsion of its people therefrom are greater [evil] in the sight of Allah. And fitnah is greater than killing." And they will continue to fight you until they turn you back from your religion if they are able. And whoever of you reverts from his religion [to disbelief] and dies while he is a disbeliever - for those, their deeds have become worthless in this world and the Hereafter, and those are the companions of the Fire, they will abide therein eternally.
Indeed, those who have believed and those who have emigrated and fought in the cause of Allah - those expect the mercy of Allah. And Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.

Tafsir Al-Ihya
وإما الرجاء بعد تأكد الأسباب ولذلك قال تعالى: ﴿ إن الذين آمنوا والذين هاجروا وجاهدوا في سبيل الله أولئك يرجون رحمة الله ﴾ معناه أولئك يستحقون أن يرجوا رحمة الله وما أراد به تخصيص وجود الرجاء لأن غيرهم أيضا قد يرجو ولكن خصص بهم استحقاق الرجاء.
Indeed, as for hope [ar-raja'] after the causes have been firmly established, and for that reason, Allah the Exalted said: ***"Indeed, those who have believed and those who have emigrated and striven in the cause of Allah - those expect the mercy of Allah."*** Its meaning is: those deserve to hope for [yarju] the mercy [rahma] of Allah. And He did not intend by it to specify the mere existence of hope [ar-raja'], for others may also hope, but He specified them with the deserving of hope [ar-raja'].

a.g: They ask you about wine and gambling. Say, "In them is great sin and [yet, some] benefit for people. But their sin is greater than their benefit." And they ask you what they should spend. Say, "The excess [beyond needs]." Thus Allah makes clear to you the verses [of revelation] that you might give thought.

To this world and the Hereafter. And they ask you about orphans. Say, "Improvement for them is best. And if you mix your affairs with theirs - they are your brothers. And Allah knows the corrupter from the amender. And if Allah had willed, He could have put you in difficulty. Indeed, Allah is Exalted in Might and Wise.

And do not marry polytheistic women until they believe. And a believing slave woman is better than a polytheist, even though she might please you. And do not marry polytheistic men [to your women] until they believe. And a believing slave is better than a polytheist, even though he might please you. Those invite [you] to the Fire, but Allah invites to Paradise and to forgiveness, by His permission. And He makes clear His verses to the people that perhaps they may remember.

Tafsir Al-Ihya
اعلم أن شواهد القرآن متظاهرة على أن الله تعالى يحب عبده فلا بد من معرفة معنى ذلك. ولنقدم الشواهد على محبته فقد قال الله تعالى: " إن الله يحب التوابين ويحب المتطهرين ". وقد روى أنس عن النبي ﭬ أنه قال: " إذا أحب الله تعالى عبداً لم يضره ذنب والتائب من الذنب كمن لا ذنب له. ثم تلا " إن الله يحب التوابين". ومعناه أنه إذا أحبه تاب عليه قبل الموت فلم تضره الذنوب الماضية وإن كثرت، كما لا يضر الكفر الماضي بعد الإسلام، وقد اشترط الله تعالى للمحبة غفران الذنب فقال: " قل إن كنتم تحبون الله فاتبعوني يحببكم الله ويغفر لكم ذنوبكم ".
Know that the evidences of the Quran are mutually supporting in that Allah, the Exalted, loves His servant, so it is necessary to know the meaning of that. And let us first present the evidences for His love, for Allah, the Exalted, has said: "Indeed, Allah loves those who constantly repent [al-tawwabin] and He loves those who purify themselves [al-mutatahhirin]." And it has been narrated by Anas from the Prophet, peace be upon him, that he said: "When Allah, the Exalted, loves a servant, sin does not harm him, and the one who repents from sin is like one who has no sin." Then he recited: "Indeed, Allah loves those who constantly repent [al-tawwabin]." And its meaning is that when He loves him, He grants him repentance before death, so past sins do not harm him, even if they are many, just as past disbelief does not harm after Islam. And Allah, the Exalted, has made the forgiveness of sin a condition for love [mahabbah], for He said: "Say, [O Muhammad], 'If you should love Allah, then follow me, [so] Allah will love you and forgive for you your sins.'"

a.g: Your wives are a place of sowing of seed for you, so come to your place of cultivation however you wish and put forth [righteousness] for yourselves. And fear Allah and know that you will meet Him. And give good tidings to the believers.
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
وأحد المعاني المذكورة في قوله تعالى فأتوا حرثكم أنى شئتم وقدموا لأنفسكم تقديم الأطفال إلى الآخرة فقد ظهر بهذه الوجوه الأربعة أن أكثر فضل النكاح لأجل كونه سببا للولد الفائدة الثانية التحصن من الشيطان وكسر التوقان ودفع غوائل الشهوة وغض البصر وحفظ الفرج وإليه الإشارة بقوله عليه السلام (من نكح فقد حصن نصف دينه فليتق الله في الشطر الآخر) وإليه الإشارة بقوله (عليكم بالباءة فمن لم يستطع فعليه بالصوم فإن الصوم له وجاء.) وأكثر ما نقلناه من الآثار والأخبار إشارة إلى هذا المعنى وهذا المعنى دون الأول لأن الشهوة موكلة بتقاضي تحصيل الولد فالنكاح كاف لشغله دافع لجعله وصارف لشر سطوته وليس من يجيب مولاه رغبة في تحصيل رضاه كمن يجيب لطلب الخلاص عن غائلة التوكيل فالشهوة والولد مقدران وبينهما ارتباط وليس يجوز أن يقال المقصود اللذة والولد لازم منها كما يلزم مثلا قضاء الحاجة من الأكل وليس مقصودا في ذاته بل الولد هو المقصود بالفطرة والحكمة والشهوة باعثة عليه.
Indeed, one of the meanings mentioned in His, the Exalted's, saying, "So come to your tilth [حرثكم] as you will, and send ahead for yourselves" is the sending ahead of children to the Hereafter. Thus, it has become clear through these four aspects that the greater virtue of marriage [النكاح] is for the sake of it being a cause for offspring. The second benefit is fortification from Satan [الشيطان], breaking the intensity of craving, repelling the dangers of lust [الشهوة], lowering the gaze, and guarding the private parts. To this is the allusion in his, peace be upon him, saying: "Whoever marries has fortified half of his religion, so let him fear Allah concerning the other half." And to this is the allusion in his saying: "Upon you is marriage [الباءة]; so whoever is not able, then upon him is fasting, for fasting is a shield for him." Most of what we have transmitted of the narrations and reports alludes to this meaning, and this meaning—not the first—because lust [الشهوة] is entrusted with demanding the attainment of offspring. Thus, marriage [النكاح] is sufficient to occupy it, repels its harm, and diverts the evil of its assault. And he who answers his Lord out of desire to attain His pleasure is not like he who answers to seek deliverance from the peril of being entrusted. For lust [الشهوة] and offspring are both decreed, and between them is a connection. And it is not permissible to say that the intended purpose is pleasure and offspring is a necessary consequence of it, just as, for example, relieving a need is a necessary consequence of eating, though it is not the purpose in itself. Rather, offspring is the intended purpose by innate disposition [الفطرة] and wisdom [الحكمة], and lust [الشهوة] is an instigator for it.

a.g: And do not make [your oath by] Allah an excuse against being righteous and fearing Allah and making peace among people. And Allah is Hearing and Knowing.
Allah does not impose blame upon you for what is unintentional in your oaths, but He imposes blame upon you for what your hearts have earned. And Allah is Forgiving and Forbearing.
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
وقوله تعالى لا يؤاخذكم الله باللغو في أيمانكم ولكن يؤاخذكم بما كسبت قلوبكم والحق عندنا في هذه المسألة لا يوقف عليه ما لم تقع الإحاطة بتفصيل أعمال القلوب من مبدأ ظهورها إلى أن يظهر العمل على الجوارح فنقول أول ما يرد على القلب الخاطر كما لو خطر له مثلا صورة امرأة وأنها وراء ظهره في الطريق لو التفت إليها لرآها والثاني هيجان الرغبة إلى النظر وهو حركة الشهوة في الطبع وهذا يتولد من الخاطر الأول ونسميه ميل الطبع ويسمى الأول حديث النفس والثالث حكم القلب بأن هذا ينبغي أن يفعل أي ينبغي أن ينظر إليها فإن الطبع إذا مال لم تنبعث الهمة والنية ما لم تندفع الصوارف فإنه قد يمنعه حياء أو خوف من الالتفات وعدم هذه الصوارف ربما يكون بتأمل وهو على كل حال حكم من جهة العقل ويسمى هذا اعتقادا وهو يتبع الخاطر والميل الرابع تصميم العزم على الالتفات وجزم النية فيه وهذا نسميه هما بالفعل ونية وقصدا وهذا الهم قد يكون له مبدأ ضعيف ولكن إذا أصغى القلب إلى الخاطر الأول حتى طالت مجاذبته للنفس تأكد هذا الهم وصار إرادة مجزومة فإذا انجزمت الإرادة فربما يندم بعد الجزم فيترك العمل وربما يغفل بعارض فلا يعمل به ولا يلتفت إليه وربما يعوقه عائق فيتعذر عليه العمل فههنا أربع أحوال للقلب قبل العمل بالجارحة الخاطر وهو حديث النفس ثم الميل ثم الاعتقاد ثم الهم فنقول أما الخاطر فلا يؤاخذ به لأنه لا يدخل تحت الاختيار وكذلك الميل وهيجان الشهوة لأنهما لا يدخلان أيضا تحت الاختيار وهما المرادان بقوله صلى الله عليه وسلم عفى عن أمتي ما حدثت به نفوسها فحديث النفس عبارة عن الخواطر التي تهجس في النفس ولا يتبعها عزم على الفعل فأما الهم والعزم فلا يسمى حديث النفس بل حديث النفس كما روي عن عثمان بن مظعون حيث قال للنبي صلى الله عليه وسلم يا رسول الله نفسي تحدثني أن أطلق خولة قال مهلا إن من سنتي النكاح قال نفسي تحدثني أن أجب نفسي قال مهلا
Indeed, Allah does not hold you accountable for your oaths which are unintentional [al-laghw], but He holds you accountable for what your hearts [qalb] have earned. And the truth [al-haqq] in this matter, in our view, cannot be grasped without encompassing the detailed workings of the hearts [qalb] from the initial point of their appearance until the action manifests upon the limbs. So We say: The first thing that occurs to the heart [qalb] is the passing thought [al-khatir], as if, for example, the image of a woman occurs to it, and that she is behind him on the road—if he were to turn to her, he would see her. The second is the stirring of desire to look, which is the movement of appetite [al-shahwa] in the natural disposition [al-tab']. This is generated from the first thought [al-khatir], and We call it the inclination of the natural disposition [al-tab']. The first is called the whisper of the soul [hadith al-nafs]. The third is the judgment [hukm] of the heart [qalb] that this ought to be done—meaning, he ought to look at her. For when the natural disposition [al-tab'] inclines, resolve [al-himma] and intention [al-niyya] are not set in motion unless the deterrents are removed. For he may be prevented by shame [al-haya'] or fear from turning. The absence of these deterrents may be due to reflection [al-ta'ammul], and this, in any case, is a judgment from the side of the intellect [al-'aql]. This is called a belief [i'tiqad], and it follows the thought [al-khatir] and the inclination [al-mayl]. The fourth is the firm resolve [tasmeem al-'azm] to turn and the decisive intention [jazm al-niyya] therein. This We call an actual concern [hamm bi al-fi'l] and an intention [niyya] and an aim [qasd]. This concern [al-hamm] may have a weak beginning, but if the heart [qalb] heeds the first thought [al-khatir] until its attraction for the soul [al-nafs] is prolonged, this concern [al-hamm] becomes confirmed and becomes a decisive will [irada majzuma]. So when the will [al-irada] is decisively formed, perhaps he regrets after the resolve [al-jazm] and abandons the action, or perhaps he is distracted by an incidental matter and does not act upon it and does not turn to it, or perhaps an obstacle hinders him so the action becomes impossible for him. Here, then, are four states [ahwal] of the heart [qalb] before action by the limb: the thought [al-khatir], which is the whisper of the soul [hadith al-nafs]; then the inclination [al-mayl]; then the belief [al-i'tiqad]; then the concern [al-hamm]. So We say: As for the thought [al-khatir], one is not held accountable for it because it does not fall under choice [al-ikhtiyar]. Likewise, the inclination [al-mayl] and the stirring of appetite [al-shahwa], because they also do not fall under choice [al-ikhtiyar]. These two are what is intended by His saying, peace be upon him: "My community is forgiven for what their souls [nufus] whisper to them." For "the whisper of the soul [hadith al-nafs]" is an expression for the thoughts [al-khawatir] that whisper in the soul [al-nafs] and are not followed by a resolve [al-'azm] to act. As for the concern [al-hamm] and the resolve [al-'azm], they are not called the whisper of the soul [hadith al-nafs]. Rather, the whisper of the soul [hadith al-nafs] is as was narrated from 'Uthman ibn Maz'un when he said to the Prophet, peace be upon him: "O Messenger of Allah, my soul [nafs] whispers to me that I should divorce Khawla." He said: "Gently. Marriage is from my way [sunnati]." He said: "My soul [nafs] whispers to me that I should deny myself." He said: "Gently."

a.g: For those who swear not to have sexual relations with their wives is a waiting time of four months, but if they return [to normal relations] - then indeed, Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.
And if they decide on divorce - then indeed, Allah is Hearing and Knowing.

Divorced women remain in waiting for three periods, and it is not lawful for them to conceal what Allah has created in their wombs if they believe in Allah and the Last Day. And their husbands have more right to take them back in this [period] if they want reconciliation. And due to the wives is similar to what is expected of them, according to what is reasonable. But the men have a degree over them [in responsibility and authority]. And Allah is Exalted in Might and Wise.

Tafsir Al-Ihya
وقال بشر بن الحرث فضل على أحمد بن حنبل بثلاث بطلب الحلال لنفسه ولغيره وأنا أطلبه لنفسي فقط ولاتساعه في النكاح وضيقي عنه ولأنه نصب إماما للعامة. ويقال إن أحمد رحمه الله تزوج في اليوم الثاني لوفاة أم ولده عبد الله وقال أكره أن أبيت عزبا وأما بشر فإنه لما قيل له إن الناس يتكلمون فيك لتركك النكاح ويقولون هو تارك للسنة فقال قولوا لهم هو مشغول بالفرض عن السنة وعوتب مرة أخرى فقال ما يمنعني من التزويج إلا قوله تعالى ولهن مثل الذي عليهن بالمعروف فذكر ذلك لأحمد فقال وأين مثل بشر إنه قعد على مثل حد السنان ومع ذلك فقد روي انه رؤي في المنام فقيل له ما فعل الله بك فقال رفعت منازلي في الجنة وأشرف بي على مقامات الأنبياء ولم أبلغ منازل المتأهلين وفي رواية قال لي ما كنت أحب أن تلقاني عزبا.
Indeed, Bishr ibn al-Harith said: "Ahmad ibn Hanbal was superior to me in three matters: in seeking the lawful [halal] for himself and for others, while I seek it only for myself; in his expansiveness in marriage [nikah] and my restriction from it; and because he established himself as an imam for the common people." And it is said that Ahmad, may God have mercy on him, married on the second day after the death of the mother of his son, Abdullah, and said: "I dislike to spend the night unmarried." As for Bishr, when it was said to him: "The people speak about you for your abandonment of marriage, and they say he is one who abandons the Sunnah," he said: "Say to them: He is occupied with the obligatory [fard] over the Sunnah." And he was reproached another time, so he said: "Nothing prevents me from marriage except His saying, the Most High: 'And for them [women] is the like of what is upon them in kindness [ma'ruf].'" This was mentioned to Ahmad, so he said: "And where is the like of Bishr? Indeed, he has sat upon the like of the spear's edge." And despite this, it has been narrated that he was seen in a dream and it was said to him: "What has God done with you?" He said: "He raised my stations in Paradise, and elevated me to behold the stations of the Prophets, yet I did not reach the stations of the married ones." And in another narration, He said to me: "I did not love that you meet Me unmarried."

a.g: Divorce is twice. Then, either keep [her] in an acceptable manner or release [her] with good treatment. And it is not lawful for you to take anything of what you have given them unless both fear that they will not be able to keep [within] the limits of Allah. But if you fear that they will not keep [within] the limits of Allah, then there is no blame upon either of them concerning that by which she ransoms herself. These are the limits of Allah, so do not transgress them. And whoever transgresses the limits of Allah - it is those who are the wrongdoers.

Indeed, if you say: "Why did 'Isa (Jesus), peace be upon him, abandon marriage despite its virtue, and if the superior path is to be free for the worship of Allah, then why did our Messenger, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, take many wives?" Then know that the superior path is to combine the two for the one who is capable, whose spiritual aspiration [himma] is strong and whose rank [manzila] is elevated, so that no preoccupation distracts him from Allah. And our Messenger, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, took the path of strength and combined the virtue of worship ['ibada] and marriage. Indeed, he was with nine women, and it is also narrated from him that he had eleven, while being completely devoted to the worship of Allah. And the fulfillment of natural desire [watar] through marriage was, in his case, no impediment.

a.g: And if he has divorced her [for the third time], then she is not lawful to him afterward until [after] she marries a husband other than him. And if the latter husband divorces her [or dies], there is no blame upon the woman and her former husband for returning to each other if they think that they can keep [within] the limits of Allah. These are the limits of Allah, which He makes clear to a people who know.

And when you divorce women and they have [nearly] fulfilled their term, either retain them according to acceptable terms or release them according to acceptable terms, and do not keep them, intending harm, to transgress [against them]. And whoever does that has certainly wronged himself. And do not take the verses of Allah in jest. And remember the favor of Allah upon you and what has been revealed to you of the Book and wisdom by which He instructs you. And fear Allah and know that Allah is Knowing of all things.

Tafsir Al-Ihya
ولذلك أمر الله تعالى الكافة بشكر نعمة الكتاب فقال تعالى ﴿ واذكروا نعمة الله عليكم وما أنزل عليكم من الكتاب والحكمة يعظكم به ﴾
And for this reason, God the Exalted commanded the community at large to be grateful for the blessing of the Book [al-Kitab], so He the Exalted said: "And remember the favor of God upon you and what He has sent down to you of the Book [al-Kitab] and wisdom [al-hikmah] by which He admonishes you."

a.g: And when you divorce women and they have fulfilled their term, do not prevent them from remarrying their [former] husbands if they agree among themselves on an acceptable basis. That is instructed to whoever of you believes in Allah and the Last Day. That is better for you and purer, and Allah knows and you know not.
